title: Speculative End-Turn Detector for Efficient Speech Chatbot Assistant
author: Hyunjong Ok (POSTECH), Suho Yoo (HJ AILAB), Jaeho Lee (POSTECH), ...
relevance_why: The proposed SpeculativeETD framework employs efficient techniques that could be leveraged for real-time audio processing in voice synthesis and recognition tasks, which align with my research interests in audio-language modeling.
background: End-turn detection in dialogues determines whether a speaker has stopped talking or is merely pausing, impacting real-time chatbot interaction.
contribution: This paper introduces the ETD dataset and the SpeculativeETD framework to solve challenges in end-turn detection, achieving high efficiency and accuracy in real-time scenarios.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing end-turn detection models often face high computational costs or limited accuracy when deployed in real-time environments.
technical_comparison.novelty: The SpeculativeETD framework combines a lightweight on-device model with a high-performance server-side model, significantly reducing computational load while maintaining accuracy.

key_innovation: The unique two-stage inference method allows for rapid initial detection with a lightweight model, followed by a more complex analysis only when necessary, optimizing resources.
real_world_impact: This approach can enhance the functionality of real-time chatbot assistants, leading to smoother and more natural conversational experiences for users.

new_terms.end-turn detection: **End-turn detection** refers to the ability of dialogue systems to identify whether a speaker has finished speaking or is merely in a pause.
new_terms.SpeculativeETD: **SpeculativeETD** is an inference framework designed to perform end-turn detection efficiently by balancing rapid processing and higher accuracy for critical turns.

open_sourcing: Datasets and code will be available after the review.
